availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Eliza Ann Austin Gathright (Louisville, Kentucky, resident)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, resident. Kentucky native. Married to Owen Gathright Sr. Mother of J. Richard Gathright, John T. Gathright, William P. Gathright, Ann A. Gathright, Eliza J. Gathright, Owen Gathright Jr., Sarah E. Gathright, Alice Bradford Gathright, Martha Gathright, and Minnie Gathright. Resident of Louisville, Kentucky, in 1860. Household owned two enslaved persons (John and Amy) in Louisville in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 4, p. 21.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 4, p. 1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville Ward 11, p. 463B.
Find A Grave, "Eliza Ann Austin Gathright (Sept. 30, 1821-June 26, 1896)," Memorial #58522037, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/58522037 (accessed March 24, 2020).
"Kentucky's Underground Railroad: Passage To Freedom,"KET Education, https://www.ket.org/education/resources/kentuckys-underground-railroad-passage-freedom/ (accessed February 27, 2020).
"Louisville Daily Journal, 1863-09-16," Internet Archive, https://archive.org/stream/xt71ns0kvz53/xt71ns0kvz53_djvu.txt (accessed February 27, 2020).
